content:
I had originally been planning not to release the audio until we had time to shoot a music video at an EMC testing lab, but someone sent the final mix out to [si-list] earlier today so might as well post it here too.

https://www.antikernel.net/temp/the-sound-of-crosstalk-final.mp3

The Sound of Crosstalk V 2.1.0
From The Sound of Silence by Simon and Garfunkel

Lyrics : Andrew Zonenberg & M Pang (USA)
Vocals : Berzan Önen (Turkey)
Instrumental : Matt Welch (Australia)

Hello Maxwell, my old friend
I've come to talk with you again
Because a current, softly creeping
Strayed its path while I was sweeping
And the problem that I'd buried in a plane
Still remains
Within the sound of crosstalk

Through restless nights I probed alone
Near striplines; -- coupled tones
'Neath the halo of a field probe
I searched my traces for the source unknown

When my plots were struck
By the ring of harmonics odd
That closed the eye
It was the sound of crosstalk

And in the chamber test I saw
Peaks that spiked by ten or more
Symbols shifting without meaning
Signals dropping without warning
SERDES sending bits
That errors never spare
And no one dared
Defy the sound of crosstalk

"Fools," said I, "you do not know
Fields spread like a cancer grows
Hear my words that I might teach you
Slow your slew that I might reach you"
But my symbols, like silent raindrops fell
And echoed in the hells of crosstalk

Countless experts swept and prayed
But the EM fields betrayed
And the BERT flashed out its warning
'Bout the link that it was dropping

And the BERT said
"The codes of the prophets are twisted by jitter's thrall"
Link margin falls
Words buried in the sound of crosstalk

https://github.com/azonenberg/parody-lyrics/blob/master/The%20Sound%20of%20Crosstalk.txt

content:
Vic Fangio on the defense's depth: "It's too early to say. ...I told the players this: I look at this year, very similar to last year in that at this time last year, we had a lot of turnover in personnel from the previous year. You had Baun, nobody knew what he was at this point last year. You had Nakobe, who hadn't played any meaningful NFL football in his first two years. You had Oren Burks, who we had just signed. You had Isaiah Rodgers, who we had just signed. You had [Moro] Ojomo, who didn't play hardly at all his rookie year. We got Nolan, who didn't play hardly at all his rookie year. We got Chauncey [Gardner-Johnson] back. We drafted [Quinyon Mitchell], Cooper, Jalyx.

"We had a lot of question marks at that time. This year, those names are replaced. Ringo, Adoree', Sydney, McCollum, Ojulari, Uche, Byron Young, Gabe Hall, [Thomas] Booker, Jihaad, all the draft picks-- Mukuba, [Ty] Robinson, Smael [Mondon Jr.], and then the rest of the rookies. Some of those guys in that second list have to become like those guys in the first list, and I don't know how that's going to turn out, but I look at us really basically the same one year to the next. The names have changed. Hopefully we'll get the same results from these new guys that we got from a lot of the new guys last year."

card.title: Kyiv Post
card.description:
Kyiv Post Chief Editor Bohdan Nahaylo shares his 40+ year path: from a young boy in Wolverhampton, UK, to one of the first voices predicting the Soviet collapse — and today, leading Ukraine’s “global voice” in wartime.

He’s written for The Spectator, The Times, Wall Street Journal, worked for Amnesty International and Radio Liberty, and was even live on CNN in 1990 predicting the USSR’s fall.

His journey took him from reporting on dissidents and exposing the Holodomor to helping rebuild the Kyiv Post from scratch in 2021 — just before Russia’s full-scale invasion.

Now, with a new team of dedicated journalists, the Kyiv Post reaches millions every month, fighting disinformation and serving as a trusted source for global readers.

A powerful reminder: journalism isn't just news — it's responsibility, resistance, and legacy.

Read the full article here.

card.description: Книга Саши Скочиленко «Мой тюремный трип», на днях выпущенная издательством «Freedom Letters», от первого лица рассказывает о нелепом и жестоком судебном процессе в Санкт-Петербурге, сфабрикованном в самом начале войны. Саша Скочиленко заменила пять ценников в магазинах, поместив на них антивоенные призывы. Хороший знакомый заманил ее в засаду и сдал властям. Дикая атмосфера суда, абсурдность дела, нечеловеческое содержание в СИЗО, и последующее внезапное избавление рассказаны словами поэтессы и художницы, единственными целями которой были и остаются призыв к миру и протест против войны. The Insider публикует фрагменты книги с авторскими иллюстрациями.

https://apnews.com/article/trump-emergency-powers-tariffs-immigration-5cbe386d8f2cc4a374a5d005e618d76a

card.title: In his second term, Trump turns to emergency powers to advance his agenda
card.description: Call it the 911 presidency. Despite insisting that the United States has rebounded from calamity under his watch, President Donald Trump is harnessing emergency powers unlike any of his predecessors. Whether it’s leveling punishing tariffs, deploying troops to the border or sidelining environmental regulations, Trump has relied on rules and laws intended only for use in extraordinary circumstances like war and invasion. An analysis by The Associated Press shows that 20% of Trump’s 150 executive orders have included some kind of emergency declaration, a proportion that far exceed those issued by any other recent president during entire four-year terms.
card.image_description: President Donald Trump holds up an executive order after signing it at an indoor Presidential Inauguration parade event in Washington, Jan. 20, 2025. (AP Photo/Matt Rourke, File)

I'm migrating from tech.lgbt I think. I am getting annoyed with the infighting between instances I want to follow people on.
I'm some kind of non-binary trans-feminine, but I'm not too worried about the specifics of my identity. I am me… whatever that means to you.If you want to call me a guy or something, then by all means do so unless i ask you to stop :p

I draw pixel art of varying quality.
I want to be genuine and connect with others empathetically, bidirectionally; we need more of that and to assume good faith more easily. I still am strongly opinionated though, so I'm sorry if I don't always live up to my own expectations.

Vetting follows, it's just a vibe check (like, have a discernible vibe and not emptiness).

LMK if I should CW something or act differently, I want to be considerate and friendly but I don't always know what upsets everyone…
I will sometimes post politics but I try to put it in content warnings unless it's some surreal silly take on politics with few or no ties to reality.

Avatar is my art of Nei, from Phantasy Star II.

Donations would mean the world to me, if you can help. Or job offers. https://ko-fi.com/wyatt8740

I do not consent to any form of content scraping for purposes of procedurally generated content, or commercial use.

account.note: A collective of thoughts and reflections. Tracing and exploring the hidden structures and patterns in culture, technology, systems, and self.

content:
We’re not just training machines to think.

We’re training them on how we think — for better and worse.

It's a thought I’m still working through.

https://substack.com/@thedisrepost/note/c-129273028?utm_source=notes-share-action&r=5ozx8m

card.title: The Disrepost on Substack
card.description:
We’ve started outsourcing cognition to machines trained not only on the best of human thoughts, but also on the worst patterns of the human mind.

This keeps echoing in my mind.

Because the data these LLM systems being trained on, being fed and rely on, it’s content. And content comes from us. The product of our minds.

Both the better parts, and the worse.

The product that has built, shape, even destroyed our civilisations. The content that contained not just our insights, but our shortcuts. Our biases, our desire to persuade, not just inform.

If we bring the same bricks from the old house to build the new one, can we really expect it to look different?

I don’t know what that means yet, not fully.

But it feels like something we’ll have to answer.

Sooner than we’re ready to.
